Novartis states that its purpose is “to re-imagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives.”

Nature  
• An aspirational, enduring reason for being – it expresses why the company exists beyond making medicines or generating profits.  
• Mission-like: it guides strategy, culture, capital allocation and day-to-day decisions.

Focus  
• Patient and societal impact – improving health outcomes and quality of life for people everywhere.  
• Innovation – “re-imagine” signals a commitment to scientific and technological breakthroughs rather than incremental change.  
• Access and scale – extending lives implies not only discovering new therapies but also making them broadly available.  
• Long-term value creation – while financial success is required, the primary focus is on meaningful medical advances that benefit patients, healthcare systems and society.
